headline.main: REPUBLICANS SEE 'GAG' IN HEARINGS ON ARMING SHIPS; Members of House Committee Protest That Two-Day Closed Inquiry 'Threatens Freedom'

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 12 -- The Congressional battle on the Administration's proposal to arm American merchant vessels started twenty-four hours ahead of schedule today when Republican members of the House Foreign Affairs Committee protested against the official decision to hold brief secret hearings on the Neutrality Act revision.
abstract: hearing limit protested by House com Repubs; hearings boycotted by Fish and Tinkham; subject debated by Mundt and 3 other Cong members, Amer Forum of the Air; Roosevelt request scored by Sens Gillette and La Follette
